WRITING.TITLE: A Collection of My Favourite Rugby Videos EVER!!
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello all! As many of you know I'm a bit of a fanatic when it comes to Rugby and videos and here is a taster of my favourites which I think a lot of you will enjoy!
**Mash Ups** [2011 World Cup Highlights](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9sSc5ZPK7P8) [Lions Tour 2013](https://youtu.be/Eb_8lFrrdSA) [All Blacks 2013 Tribute](https://youtu.be/BREqs_sk59M) [Tribute to Rugby](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Bqrh04aHmU) [England Rugby Golden Era](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2USK9DolxU) [Super Rugby 2011 (Best Season Ever)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mXGAxJT7PXc)
Just a few here. If you liked them I have about 20 more videos I would happily add!
Agreed. I remember in the mid noughties seeing Tom Voyce really emerge as a strong starter for Wasps thanks to that tournament. Needs to have that new player focus again.
He is an absolute mammoth of a player! Do you think he is the kind of player who could handle the captaincy for South Africa?
Here here!
/r/photoshopbattles
https://imgur.com/a/ebgCE
Never the same...
I think it's a second, larger explosion.
It's just awful isn't it.
I remember browsing on youtube and it came up. It's so realistic. All world leaders should be made to sit down and watch it!
[Link to full movie.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3NxkEDpl-40) You have been warned, it will change you.

WRITING.TITLE: Never has a film quite affected me like "Threads". A documentary style film about what would happen if a nuclear bomb was dropped on England. Here is the bombing scene itself.

As someone who appears to be a meme king. I will say this. I personally love this sub. Whenever a "big rugby event" comes along there's is always a post that seems to sum up my thoughts in a clear concise and in many ways funny fashion.
I love a good meme and in doing have embraced this in many of my posts. However if we all as a collective decide that it has gone too far then I would happily never post one on here ever again. I think we all personally have a good sense of what is a good post and a genuine 'shitpost' and I personally know that me and glove have our rugby hats firmly on. Either way we will contribute to this sub so it depends on what you prefer.

Same. I tried to contact them but they had no way of contacting. I have managed to snag an agreement with Rugby Pass now so I'll be able to upload content without the fear of copyright. (He says)

WRITING.TITLE: Right Place at the Right Time

WRITING.TEXT: Lionel Beauxis vs New Zealand in 2007 was pretty spectacular.
All I see is a good boy.
[Video of attackers pre attack](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jiWrfVM-NjI)

Martin Johnson.
I know he had some [pretty](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=57bljsPw3pk) [hairy](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FCsPN1FyqKE) [times](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9S3prkjtp3I) as coach but he did do some great things for England.
Blooded a whole host of players after 2007 such as,
Chris Ashton Courtney Lawes James Haskell Dylan Hartley Ben Foden
Just to name a few. He did manage to win England their first six nations in 2011 and beat Australia for the first time in yonks on their patch. I think he did a pretty good job apart from a few very significant losses.
Very good read. Enjoyed the last sentence the most.
Obligatory.
Absolute cracker. When South Africa were at their ultimate peak!

About to start work but will give a basic one line answer to that.
Whenever the player grounds the ball, the kicker must attempt to kick the conversation in line from where he grounded it. The closer to the centre the easier it is for the kicker to convert and gain those extra two points from the conversion.
Edit: 6 line.
Been teetering towards 50k for a while now. Well done lads. Lions tour should help us grow more!
